Module comp3111.examsystem
Package comp3111.examsystem.controller

Class TeacherQuestionBankManagementController

java.lang.Object
comp3111.examsystem.controller.BaseManagementController<TeacherQuestionBankManagementController.QuestionRecord>
comp3111.examsystem.controller.TeacherQuestionBankManagementController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Initializable
public class TeacherQuestionBankManagementController extends BaseManagementController<TeacherQuestionBankManagementController.QuestionRecord>
Controller class for managing the teacher's question bank in the exam system. This class extends the BaseManagementController and provides functionality to add, update, delete, filter, and manage question records in the question bank. It also handles the UI interactions with JavaFX components such as tables, fields, and combo boxes.

Features include:

  • Displaying questions and their details in a table view
  • Adding new questions (Single choice, Multiple choice, short answer, True/False) with validation checks
  • Updating existing questions with validation checks
  • Deleting questions with confirmation
  • Refreshing the table view to reflect the latest database
  • Filtering and clearing filters for displayed questions

    • typeMap

      private Map<Integer,String> typeMap
      A mapping of question type indices to their corresponding type names.
      • 0 -> "Single"
      • 1 -> "Multiple"
      • 2 -> "True/False"
      • 3 -> "Short Question"

  • Constructor Details

    • TeacherQuestionBankManagementController

      public TeacherQuestionBankManagementController()
      Constructs a new TeacherQuestionBankManagementController. This constructor initializes the controller with the path to the JSON file that stores question data and populates the typeMap with question types.

  • Method Details

    • containsOnlyAbcd

      private static boolean containsOnlyAbcd(String str)
      Checks if a given string contains only the characters 'A', 'B', 'C', and 'D'.
      Parameters:
      str - the input string to check
      Returns:
      true if the string contains only 'A', 'B', 'C', and 'D'; false otherwise

    • mapBinaryToLetters

      public static String mapBinaryToLetters(String binaryString)
      Maps a 4-bit binary string (e.g., "1010") to a string of letters, where each '1' in the binary string corresponds to a letter from 'A' to 'D'. The first bit corresponds to 'A', the second to 'B', and so on. For example, the binary string "1010" maps to "AC".
      Parameters:
      binaryString - a 4-bit binary string
      Returns:
      a string of letters corresponding to the binary string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input is not exactly 4 bits long

    • IndexToLetter

      private static String IndexToLetter(String value)
      Converts a numeric index (as a string) to the corresponding letter, where '0' maps to 'A', '1' maps to 'B', and so on.
      Parameters:
      value - the numeric index as a string
      Returns:
      the corresponding letter in the alphabet
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the input string cannot be parsed as an integer

    • validateInput

      protected boolean validateInput()
      Validates input from the form fields to ensure that all required fields are filled out and that the data conforms to expected formats based on the question type.
      Specified by:
      validateInput in class BaseManagementController<TeacherQuestionBankManagementController.QuestionRecord>
      Returns:
      true if all input is valid; false otherwise. If the input is invalid, an alert is displayed to the user indicating the nature of the validation failure.

    • clearFields

      protected void clearFields()
      Clears all input fields in the form, resetting them to their default state. This includes the question text field, answer fields, score field, and type combo box. The method also ensures that the options fields are cleared only if they are managed.
      Specified by:
      clearFields in class BaseManagementController<TeacherQuestionBankManagementController.QuestionRecord>

    • createJsonFromFields

      protected org.json.JSONObject createJsonFromFields()
      Creates a JSON object representing a new question based on the current input fields. The JSON object includes the question ID, statement, score, type, solution, and options.
      Returns:
      A JSONObject containing the question details formatted for storage or transmission. The structure of the JSON object includes: - id: Unique identifier for the question. - statement: The text of the question. - score: The score associated with the question. - type: An integer representing the type of question (e.g., MC, TF). - solution: The correct answer(s) to the question. - options: An array of possible answer options based on the question type.

    • createRecordFromJson

      protected TeacherQuestionBankManagementController.QuestionRecord createRecordFromJson(org.json.JSONObject jsonObject)
      Creates a QuestionRecord object from the provided JSON object. This method extracts the question details from the JSON and populates a new QuestionRecord instance with the corresponding fields.
      Specified by:
      createRecordFromJson in class BaseManagementController<TeacherQuestionBankManagementController.QuestionRecord>
      Parameters:
      jsonObject - The JSONObject containing the question details. It must include the following fields: - id: Unique identifier for the question. - statement: The text of the question. - score: The score associated with the question. - type: An integer representing the type of question. - options: An array of possible answer options. - solution: The correct answer(s) to the question.
      Returns:
      A QuestionRecord populated with data extracted from the JSON object.

    • removeRecordFromJson

      protected org.json.JSONArray removeRecordFromJson(org.json.JSONArray jsonArray, TeacherQuestionBankManagementController.QuestionRecord record)
      Removes a specific QuestionRecord from a JSONArray of question records. This method iterates through the provided JSON array, checks each question's ID against the ID of the given record, and constructs a new JSONArray excluding the specified record.
      Parameters:
      jsonArray - The JSONArray containing multiple question records.
      record - The QuestionRecord to be removed from the jsonArray. It is identified by its unique ID.
      Returns:
      A new JSONArray containing all the original records except for the specified record.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the user action (e.g., button click).

    • delete

      protected void delete(ActionEvent event)
      Deletes the selected question record after user confirmation. This method checks if a record is selected, prompts the user for confirmation, and attempts to delete the record from storage. Alerts the user about the result of the deletion attempt.
      Specified by:
      delete in class BaseManagementController<TeacherQuestionBankManagementController.QuestionRecord>
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the user action (e.g., button click).

    • filter

      protected void filter(ActionEvent event)
      Filters the displayed question records based on user input from the filter fields. This method applies filtering criteria to the current list of records and updates the displayed items in the table view.
      Overrides:
      filter in class BaseManagementController<TeacherQuestionBankManagementController.QuestionRecord>
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the user action (e.g., button click).

    • clearFilters

      protected void clearFilters()
      Clears all filters applied to the question records, resetting the filter fields to their default states. This method is used to show all available records without any filtering.
      Overrides:
      clearFilters in class BaseManagementController<TeacherQuestionBankManagementController.QuestionRecord>
